column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Sign a Painting
#Text=Adding a signature to your painting will make it easier for people to identify you as the artist , even after your painting has been sold and moved around .
#Text=The signature on your painting should be legible and clear without being a distraction .
#Text=You want it to blend in and match the rest of your painting so it does n't look out of place .
#Text=By taking the time to come up with a good signature and choosing the right spot for it , you can ensure you get the credit for your artwork that you deserve .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Coming up with Your Signature
#Text=Sign your painting with your full name or last name .
#Text=Avoid signing with your initials or a monogram or people may not be able to identify you as the artist .
#Text=Even if some people recognize your initials or monogram now , other people might not , and your painting could eventually become unidentifiable if your full or last name is n't on it .
#Text=Use a signature that ’s easy to read .
#Text=If people ca n’t read your signature , they wo n’t be able to identify you as the artist .
#Text=It 's true that some famous artists have illegible signatures , but they can get away with it because a lot of people in the art world are familiar with them .
#Text=If your signature is illegible , future owners of your painting will have a hard time finding out who you are .
#Text=Practice signing a legible signature on a piece of paper .
#Text=Then , show a few friends and ask if they can read it .
#Text=If they ca n’t , work on making it easier to read .
#Text=Use the same signature on all of your paintings .
#Text=That way people will start to recognize your signature overtime , which will make your artwork easier to identify .
#Text=If your signature is always different , people might not realize your paintings were made by the same artist .
#Text=If you do n’t like the signature you ’ve used in the past , come up with a new one now and use it on all your future paintings .
#Text=Avoid using an eye-catching signature .
#Text=A signature that is too bold can take away from the rest of your painting .
#Text=Your signature should be noticeable enough that people looking for it can find it , but not so noticeable that it ’s the first thing people ’s eyes are drawn to .
#Text=An easy way to make your signature blend in is to paint it using a color that appears a lot in your painting .
#Text=Choosing a Spot to Sign
#Text=Sign in a bottom corner of your painting if you want a traditional signature .
#Text=You can sign in the left or right bottom corner , although signing in the right bottom corner is more common .
#Text=If you do sign in the bottom corner , place your signature from the edge of your painting .
#Text=That way if your painting is framed , your signature wo n’t be covered up .
#Text=Sign somewhere inside of the painting if you want a less obvious signature .
#Text=You could place your signature inside of an object in your painting , or have it going vertically up the side of something .
#Text=If you do place your signature inside of your painting , make sure it blends in by keeping it small and using a color that matches the colors around it .
#Text=For example , if your painting features a bowl of apples , you could place your signature inside one of the apples and paint it a shade of red so it blends in .
#Text=Put your full name on the back if your signature is n't your full name .
#Text=Then people can check the back of your painting for your full name if you only have your last name on the front .
#Text=This will make it easier for someone to identify you as the artist later on .
#Text=Adding your Signature
#Text=Sign your painting right after you finish it .
#Text=This will help your signature blend in with the rest of your painting .
#Text=If you wait for your painting to dry before you sign it , your signature will stand out more and look like it was added later on .
#Text=Also , collectors prefer paintings where the signature was added at the time the painting was finished because they are harder to forge .
#Text=Sign your painting using the same medium you painted it with .
#Text=Using the same medium will help your signature blend in with the rest of your painting .
#Text=Avoid using a different medium to sign your signature or it could clash with your painting and look out of place .
#Text=For example , if you used watercolor paints to make your painting , you should use watercolor paints to sign your signature .
#Text=If you made your painting with oil paints , you would n’t want to paint your signature with acrylic paint .
#Text=Add the year you made the painting to your signature .
#Text=It will help you and future owners of your art keep track of when it was painted .
#Text=Right after you sign your name , put the year you made the painting .
#Text=If you do n’t want the year on the front , paint it on the back so people can reference it .
#Text=You can abbreviate the year if you want .
#Text=For example , instead of signing “ 2017 , ” you could just put “ 17 . ”
